title: Typographic magazines?
content:
Hi everyone,  
I’m looking for a typographic magazine to subscribe to,  
since typographic magazines are none existing at the kiosks in Norway.  
I have previously subscribed to Baseline, which I’m satisfied with,  
but does anyone have any other magazines to suggest?

I has to be in english, and I’m looking to learn more about,  
technical and historical aspects of typography.

Oystein

 [‹ How to search?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906155225/http:/typophile.com/node/12941 "Go to previous forum topic") [question about typecon 2005 ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906155225/http:/typophile.com/node/12901 "Go to next forum topic")
author: oystein

comments.content:
“Typo” from Czech republic is a good one.

ChrisL

The two that stand out for me are: TYPO (very focused on type design), and tipoGrafica (not in that wiki). Both are bilingual (with English).

hhp

I just put a stub for [tipoGráfica](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906155225/http:/typophile.com/wiki/tipoGrafica) in the [TypoWiki](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906155225/http:/typophile.com/wiki/TypoWiki), Hrant. I’ll leave it to you to add the pertinent information. ;^D

Paul and Hrant: By [tipoGrafica](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906155225/http:/typophile.com/wiki/tipoGrafica) do you mean the publication by [Rubén Fontana](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906155225/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Rub%2525C3%2525A9n%252BFontana), [tipoGráfica](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906155225/http:/typophile.com/wiki/tipoGr%2525C3%2525A1fica)? Or is it a different but closely named magazine?

Just trying to avoid any future wiki problems.

:)

Yeah, that’s the one. Hey Paul, slap an acute on “a” that will ya?

hhp

i think [we’ve agreed](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906155225/http:/typophile.com/node/12149) that actual wiki entry titles shouldn’t contain diacritics, but they should be displayed in the body copy. but i can change that to display the á for you as i did in my post above.

The reason I worried over the acute is that in the entry for [Rubén Fontana](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906155225/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Rub%2525C3%2525A9n%252BFontana) (which has a diacritic, too), there’s a link to [tipoGráfica](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906155225/http:/typophile.com/wiki/tipoGr%2525C3%2525A1fica). I guess it’s that entry that needs to be updated, not the “Publications” one. Sorry for not having read the Wiki etiquette thread. Will do sometime soon. :)

Let’s not forget the Swiss magazine: Typographische Monatsblätter/Revue suisse de l’imprimerie.

[http://www.comedia.ch/fr/2-Publications/RSI/actuel.php3](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906155225/http:/www.comedia.ch/fr/2-Publications/RSI/actuel.php3 "http://www.comedia.ch/fr/2-Publications/RSI/actuel.php3")

I’m liking the brand new _Slanted_ magazine, being produced by MAGMA Design in Karlsruhe. This is the same team that runs the German design blog [Slanted.de](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906155225/http:/www.slanted.de/). They gave away the first issue (#0) at TYPO Berlin. The magazine appears to be mostly in German, with some English. If you can read German (or even if you can’t…) I think a subscription may be worth it.

Call them up, or e-mail them at [MAGMA](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906155225/http:/www.magma-ka.de/index.html) for subscription info.

\_\_  
 [www.typeoff.de](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906155225/http:/www.typeoff.de/ "www.typeoff.de")

Then there is **the** must-have German/English [Spatium](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906155225/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Spatium), from [Typosition](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906155225/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Typosition) ( [spatium-magazin.de](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906155225/http:/www.spatium-magazin.de/)).

\_\_  
 [www.typeoff.de](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906155225/http:/www.typeoff.de/ "www.typeoff.de")

Thanks everyone!  
I’m going to try TYPO and tipoGráfica first, but I’ve also emailed MAGMA with some enquiries related to subscription and language. I could not access the Spatium site, I’ll have to check back on that later.

Oy

Dot dot dot magazine is a nice one, too. Check it out here:

[http://www.dot-dot-dot.nl/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906155225/http:/www.dot-dot-dot.nl/ "http://www.dot-dot-dot.nl/")

Oystein, I typed in the link to spatium incorrectly. That is why you couldn’t load the site. I fixed my link above, but here it is again: [www.spatium-magazin.de](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906155225/http:/www.spatium-magazin.de/)

\_\_  
 [www.typeoff.de](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906155225/http:/www.typeoff.de/ "www.typeoff.de")
If I’m not mistaken, Interrobang 3 is set to be released at TypeCon this July in NYC.

Dan, I emailed Magma about Slanted, and they told me you can download a PDF of the pilot. It’s out today at this link:  
 [www.slanted.de/383](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906155225/http:/www.slanted.de/383 "www.slanted.de/383")

Oystein
